intro: Zeuxine tabiyahanensis, commonly known as the Armenian zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
